conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have height/thickness, multiple faces are visible, and the camera is angled with ceiling removed to expose interiors.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion of walls with thickness and readable room volumes; clean cutaway. Minor softness/blur reduces confidence in corner precision and some surface separation.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall multi-room apartment massing is similar (central living zone with surrounding bedrooms and service core), but exterior deck/terrace geometry from the 2D plan is not clearly represented and some room proportions/partition placements look approximated.

interior_elements.notes: Beds and a living seating area are present; bathrooms appear as simplified blocks. Kitchen/utility elements are not clearly identifiable with correct placement due to low detail/blur.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors/windows are distinguishable, but the render is hazy/low-contrast, making openings and internal partitions hard to verify precisely. Clean background with no label/UI clutter.

detected_errors.description: Exterior deck/terrace areas shown in the 2D plan are not clearly modeled/visible in the 3D cutaway, indicating partial layout omission/approximation.
Door and window placements/sizes cannot be confidently matched to the 2D plan; openings appear simplified and some door locations are unclear.
Soft/blurred rendering reduces geometric readability, limiting verification of wall junctions and partition accuracy.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion is achieved with strong volumetric walls, but several plan-specific features (notably decks and some partition/opening fidelity) appear simplified or missing.
